title: Theater Vocabulary
description: Test your knowledge of stage and theater terminology from the world of performing arts

questions.question: In theater, what does 'blocking' refer to?
options: The planned movement and positioning of actors on stage

questions.question: What is a 'soliloquy' in theater?
options: A song performed by the chorus
A fight scene between two characters
A speech where a character speaks their thoughts aloud while alone on stage
The final scene of a play

questions.question: What does 'stage left' mean from the actor's perspective?
options: The exit side of the stage
The left side as the audience sees it
The actor's left when facing the audience

questions.question: In theater, what is the 'fourth wall'?
options: The back wall of the stage
The imaginary wall between performers and the audience
The wall separating backstage from the stage

questions.question: What does 'downstage' mean in theater terminology?
options: The area farthest from the audience
The area closest to the audience

questions.question: What is a 'monologue' in theater?
options: A long speech by one character addressed to others

questions.question: In theater, what is 'the wings'?
options: The areas on either side of the stage hidden from the audience

questions.question: What does 'strike the set' mean in theater?
options: Hit the scenery for sound effects
Dismantle and remove the set after a production ends
Paint the set a new color

questions.question: What is an 'understudy' in theater?
options: A performer who learns a role to substitute if needed

questions.question: In theater, what is a 'proscenium'?
options: The arch or frame separating the stage from the audience

questions.question: What does 'ad-lib' mean in theater?
options: Improvise dialogue not in the script

questions.question: What is a 'curtain call' in theater?
options: The final line of the play
The signal to open the curtain
When performers return to stage after the show to acknowledge applause
A phone call to the director

questions.question: In theater, what is 'the green room'?
options: A backstage room where performers relax before and after going on stage
A room painted green for good luck

questions.question: What does 'break a leg' mean in theater?
options: A wish of good luck before a performance
